Award.AwardTitle: What is the role of MOOCs in Engineering Education?

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration: The goal of this series of workshops is to engage engineering faculty in a discussion of the role of Massive, Open, On-line Courses (MOOCs) in undergraduate engineering education. The workshops are scheduled to take place at major conferences for three different professional societies: American Society of Engineering Education, the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, and the American Society of Mechanical Engineering. This series of workshops brings together content experts and learning experts who would not otherwise collaborate to discuss MOOCs and their role in engineering education. The outcome of the workshops is a report to NSF that summarizes the issues raised by the panelists and the participants. Another outcome of this workshop is the creation of a moderated forum in which faculty can discuss issues associated with MOOCs.

Institution.Name: The University of Central Florida Board of Trustees

POR.DRECONTENT:
The goal of this project was to organize a workshop series that brings together engineering content experts and learning science experts to facilitate discussions on MOOCs in Engineering Education, and develop a research agenda around this topic. 

For each of the conferences the diverse panels included one or more content experts, learning expert, and a MOOCs representative. Over 200 people engaged in various aspects of undergraduate engineering education were participated in the workshops. The workshop participants included engineering faculty across academic ranks, postdocs and graduate students. 

One scholarly publication has resulted from this study. Additionally, the project was featured in ASEE’s Accelerator magazine. Moreover, the findings were presented at NSF to program officers who develop programs and make funding decisions about ways to improve undergraduate STEM education.  Two publications are in progress.

This workshop series brought together a panel of experts and engineering education teachers and researchers to have a national conversation about the role of MOOCs in engineering education. In addition to raising awareness about MOOCs, stimulating conversation and collaborations, the insights resulting from this study is the beginning to steps to effectively leverage MOOCs, one the latest and disruptive innovations in undergraduate education. Although engineering was the focus of this study, the findings of this work have implications for various fields within STEM education.
